article.headline: Detroit 77, Wright St. 67
article.story: DAYTON, Ohio -- Chris Blake scored a career-high 21 points and Nick Minnerath and Eli Holman had double-doubles as Detroit rallied to defeat Wright State 77-67 on Friday night in the regular-season finale for both teams. The Titans (16-15, 10-8 Horizon League) secured the fifth seed in the conference tournament while the Raiders (18-13, 10-8), who came in ranked fifth, dropped a spot. Trailing 32-27 at halftime, Detroit opened the second half on a 17-7 run and shot 68 percent (17 of 25) in the frame. After Wright State got to 64-62 with 2:31 left, Chase Simon hit a 3-pointer, Holman made two free throws and Simon added a layup to pull away. Minnerath had 19 points and 10 rebounds, while Holman added 13 points and 11 rebounds for the Titans, who shot 8 of 13 from the 3-point line (61.5 percent) and outrebounded Wright State 38-21. Vaughn Duggins led the Raiders with 27 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
